perturbation.original_text: 4.3 NTC shall invoice ALFA AESAR for payment of Products delivered to ALFA AESAR on a Net 30 day basis. Excepting any amounts disputed in good faith, balances unpaid after such period will be subject to a finance charge of 1% per month or may be offset against any balances owed by NTC to ALFA AESAR. The parties agree to work in good faith to resolve any disputed invoice. In the event such efforts do not resolve the dispute within sixty (60) days, either party may initiate Arbitration proceedings pursuant to Section 16.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.3 NTC shall invoice ALFA AESAR for payment of Products delivered to ALFA AESAR on a Net 30 day basis. Excepting any amounts disputed in good faith, balances unpaid after such period will be subject to a finance charge of 1% per month or may be offset against any balances owed by NTC to ALFA AESAR. However, balances unpaid after 45 days will not be subject to any finance charges. The parties agree to work in good faith to resolve any disputed invoice. In the event such efforts do not resolve the dispute within sixty (60) days, either party may initiate Arbitration proceedings pursuant to Section 16.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding late payment fees. The original text states that unpaid balances after 30 days are subject to a 1% monthly finance charge. The added sentence states that balances unpaid after 45 days are not subject to any finance charges. This creates uncertainty as to when late fees are applicable, potentially leading to disputes. One section mentions 30 days for fees, while the other references 45 days without fees.

perturbation.original_text: 13. Term.    13.1 The initial term of this Agreement shall be for a period of five (5) years from the date first set forth above and shall thereafter automatically renew for additional two (2) year terms unless a party provides the other party with notice of non-renewal no less than 6 months prior to the expiration of the initial term or any renewal term unless earlier terminated as follows:   13.1.1 In the event of material breach, the non-breaching party shall give the breaching party sixty (60) days written notice of such breach. If substantial efforts to cure the breach are not taken within the sixty (60) day notice period, the non-breaching party may, at its sole discretion, terminate the agreement.   13.1.2 In the event a party becomes insolvent or if a party is declared bankrupt or makes an assignment for the benefit of creditors or in the event a receiver is appointed or any proceeding is demanded by, for or against a party under any provision of any bankruptcy law which is not withdrawn within sixty (60) days, the other party to this Agreement shall have the sole right to immediately terminate; or   13.1.3 By either party for any reason by providing six (6) months prior written notice expressly terminating this Agreement. Such notice may be by facsimile transmission or other written communication.
perturbation.changed_text: 13. Term. 13.1 The initial term of this Agreement shall be for a period of five (5) years from the date first set forth above and shall thereafter automatically renew for additional two (2) year terms unless a party provides the other party with notice of non-renewal no less than 6 months prior to the expiration of the initial term or any renewal term unless earlier terminated as follows: 13.1.1 In the event of material breach, the non-breaching party shall give the breaching party sixty (60) days written notice of such breach. If substantial efforts to cure the breach are not taken within the sixty (60) day notice period, the non-breaching party may, at its sole discretion, terminate the agreement. 13.1.2 In the event a party becomes insolvent or if a party is declared bankrupt or makes an assignment for the benefit of creditors or in the event a receiver is appointed or any proceeding is demanded by, for or against a party under any provision of any bankruptcy law which is not withdrawn within sixty (60) days, the other party to this Agreement shall have the sole right to immediately terminate; or 13.1.3 By either party for any reason by providing ninety (90) days prior written notice expressly terminating this Agreement. Such notice may be by facsimile transmission or other written communication.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates an in-text contradiction regarding the notice period required for termination. The original text states that either party can terminate the agreement with six (6) months' notice. However, the modified text states that either party can terminate the agreement with ninety (90) days written notice. This leads to ambiguity and uncertainty about the correct notice period for termination.

perturbation.original_text: 9.2. Subject to the protocol in Section 5.1, ALFA AESAR may return to NTC any Product that is defective or that fails to comply with the purchase order provided by ALFA AESAR. NTC shall return to ALFA AESAR as promptly as possible, a working replacement or, in the event such replacement is not possible or at ALFA AESAR's election, it shall credit ALFA AESAR's account for the invoiced price and shipping charges of the defective Product. The correction of such defective Product shall be at no cost to ALFA AESAR. The cost of shipping the replacement Product back to ALFA AESAR shall be paid by NTC. THE CORRECTION OF SUCH DEFECT BY REPAIR OR CREDITING ALFA AESAR'S ACCOUNT FOR THE COST OF THE PRODUCT IN THE MANNER SET FORTH ABOVE SHALL CONSTITUTE THE SOLE AND EXCLUSIVE REMEDY OF DISTRIBUTOR WITH RESPECT TO ANY WARRANTY GIVEN HEREIN RELATING TO ANY PRODUCT SOLD OR DELIVERED HEREUNDER.
perturbation.changed_text: 9.2. Subject to the protocol in Section 5.1, ALFA AESAR may return to NTC any Product that is defective or that fails to comply with the purchase order provided by ALFA AESAR. NTC shall return to ALFA AESAR as promptly as possible, a working replacement or, in the event such replacement is not possible or at ALFA AESAR's election, it shall credit ALFA AESAR's account for the invoiced price and shipping charges of the defective Product. The correction of such defective Product shall be at no cost to ALFA AESAR. The cost of shipping the replacement Product back to ALFA AESAR shall be shared equally by NTC and ALFA AESAR. THE CORRECTION OF SUCH DEFECT BY REPAIR OR CREDITING ALFA AESAR'S ACCOUNT FOR THE COST OF THE PRODUCT IN THE MANNER SET FORTH ABOVE SHALL CONSTITUTE THE SOLE AND EXCLUSIVE REMEDY OF DISTRIBUTOR WITH RESPECT TO ANY WARRANTY GIVEN HEREIN RELATING TO ANY PRODUCT SOLD OR DELIVERED HEREUNDER.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding who is responsible for the return shipping costs for defective products. The original text states that the cost of shipping the replacement product back to ALFA AESAR shall be paid by NTC. The modified text states that the cost of shipping the replacement product back to ALFA AESAR shall be shared equally by NTC and ALFA AESAR. This creates ambiguity over which party is responsible for the shipping costs, leading to uncertainty.
